places.name: Eiffel Tower
places.description: An iconic iron tower in Paris, offering breathtaking views of the city.
places.about: Built in 1889, the Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous structures in the world. It offers multiple observation decks, fine dining, and nightly light shows.

places.name: Great Wall of China
places.description: A series of fortifications built to protect ancient China from invasions.
places.about: Stretching over 13,000 miles, the Great Wall is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most impressive architectural feats in history.

places.name: Grand Canyon
places.description: A vast canyon carved by the Colorado River, known for its stunning landscapes.
places.about: The Grand Canyon is one of the seven natural wonders of the world. Visitors can enjoy hiking, rafting, and breathtaking scenic views.

places.name: Santorini
places.description: A stunning Greek island known for its white-washed buildings and blue-domed churches.
places.about: Santorini offers breathtaking sunsets, crystal-clear waters, and a unique volcanic landscape. It is a paradise for travelers seeking relaxation and beauty.

places.name: Machu Picchu
places.description: An ancient Incan citadel located in the Andes Mountains.
places.about: Machu Picchu is a breathtaking remnant of the Incan Empire, offering panoramic views and deep historical significance.

places.name: Santorini
places.description: A stunning Greek island known for its white-washed buildings and blue-domed churches.
places.about: Santorini offers breathtaking sunsets, crystal-clear waters, and a unique volcanic landscape. It is a paradise for travelers seeking relaxation and beauty.

places.name: Taj Mahal
places.description: A stunning white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife.
places.about: One of the Seven Wonders of the World, the Taj Mahal in Agra is a symbol of eternal love and an architectural masterpiece blending Persian, Islamic, and Indian styles.

places.name: Lotus Temple
places.description: A stunning Bahá'í House of Worship in New Delhi, known for its unique lotus-shaped architecture.
places.about: The Lotus Temple is a peaceful sanctuary open to people of all religions, emphasizing unity and meditation in a breathtakingly designed structure.

places.name: India Gate
places.description: A majestic war memorial located in the heart of New Delhi, dedicated to Indian soldiers who lost their lives in World War I.
places.about: Standing at 42 meters, India Gate is an iconic landmark and a symbol of patriotism, with an eternal flame (Amar Jawan Jyoti) burning in honor of the fallen soldiers.

places.name: Kerala Backwaters
places.description: A network of serene lakes, canals, and lagoons in the southern state of Kerala, offering houseboat cruises.
places.about: The Kerala Backwaters provide a unique travel experience, with lush greenery, traditional houseboats, and diverse wildlife. It's a paradise for nature lovers and those seeking tranquility.
